html: Beware of scammers during the rebuild process. Scam artists often appear after disasters like Hurricane Florence. html: Here's what you should throw out after a power outage: Meat, poultry, seafood products Soft/shredded cheeses Milk, cream, yogurt & other dairy products Opened baby formula Eggs and egg products Dough, cooked pasta Cooked or cut producthttps://flic.kr/p/KfCrZD
text:

 Meat, poultry, seafood products
 Soft/shredded cheeses
 Milk, cream, yogurt & other dairy products
 Opened baby formula
 Eggs and egg products
 Dough, cooked pasta
 Cooked or cut producthttps://flic.kr/p/KfCrZD

html: Inland flooding is the #1 cause of tropical storm fatalities. Follow these tips when in an area at risk or already flooded by #FlorenceNC: - Listen to local officials for evacuation notices. - DO NOT drive through standing water. A few inches of water can sweep a car away.pic.twitter.com/mhcXgDid1S
text:
Inland flooding is the #1 cause of tropical storm fatalities. Follow these tips when in an area at risk or already flooded by #FlorenceNC:
- Listen to local officials for evacuation notices.
- DO NOT drive through standing water. A few inches of water can sweep a car away.pic.twitter.com/mhcXgDid1S

html: Please share this safety info for #Florence: If trapped in a building, go to the highest floor. Do not climb into a closed attic; you may get trapped by rising floodwater. Get on the roof only if necessary. Call 9-1-1 for emergencies.pic.twitter.com/Hna2aGpmMP
text:
Please share this safety info for #Florence:
If trapped in a building, go to the highest floor.
Do not climb into a closed attic; you may get trapped by rising floodwater.
Get on the roof only if necessary.

Call 9-1-1 for emergencies.pic.twitter.com/Hna2aGpmMP

html: #FlorenceNC safety tips: - STAY INDOORS. Do not venture out during the storm. - Do NOT drive or walk through stagnant or moving floodwaters. - If your power goes out, do NOT operate gas powered generators or charcoal grills in or near your home. - Have your emergency kit ready!
text:
#FlorenceNC safety tips:
- STAY INDOORS. Do not venture out during the storm.
- Do NOT drive or walk through stagnant or moving floodwaters. 
- If your power goes out, do NOT operate gas powered generators or charcoal grills in or near your home.
- Have your emergency kit ready!

html: If you need to evacuate for Hurricane #Florence, today is your last day to go before the storm arrives. You can text SHELTER and your zip code (i.e. SHELTER 12345) to 4FEMA (43362) to locate an open emergency shelter near you.pic.twitter.com/vv0UPzw0wS

html: #HurricaneFlorence is very large and incredibly dangerous. Follow local evacuation orders! Prepare for life-threatening, catastrophic flooding over portions of the Carolinas and Mid-Atlantic states late this week into early next week.pic.twitter.com/IWlJYKOZBS

html: Latest models show a ridge building over eastern US slowing down Florence near our coast, stalling, then moving into SC. Impacts will still be felt far away from center of storm, and uncertainty still exists regarding magnitude of impacts in our area.pic.twitter.com/Ym8eB7Ko6t

html: On this day in 71B.C. the Thracian gladiator Spartacus was put to death by Marcus Licinius Crassus for disclosing confidential scrolls. When informed days later that in fact the Roman Senate had already publicly released the scrolls, Crassus replied “Oh, ok, my bad”.
text: On this day in 71B.C. the Thracian gladiator Spartacus was put to death by Marcus Licinius Crassus for disclosing confidential scrolls. When informed days later that in fact the Roman Senate had already publicly released the scrolls, Crassus replied  “Oh, ok, my bad”.

html: “You know... I knew Spartacus.”pic.twitter.com/94eGPCkOp1

html: It is disappointing that many Senate Democrats continue to give in to the pressure from partisan special interest groups, with many of them announcing their opposition—sight-unseen—before Judge Kavanaugh was even nominated. #SCOTUS
text: It is disappointing that many Senate Democrats continue to give in to the pressure from partisan special interest groups, with many of them announcing their opposition—sight-unseen—before Judge Kavanaugh was even nominated. #SCOTUS

html: There is no applause line among the American people for ‘let’s get out of NATO’ and I am confident NATO will be stronger and more unified 10yrs from now with more members and funding. Unlike authoritarian countries, the US has co-equal branches to decide our treaties. #NATOSummit
text: There is no applause line among the American people for ‘let’s get out of NATO’ and I am confident NATO will be stronger and more unified 10yrs from now with more members and funding. Unlike authoritarian countries, the US has co-equal branches to decide our treaties. #NATOSummit

text: While the President’s executive order was a necessary step, Congress still needs to take action to make our laws clear and consistent so children are not separated from their families in the future. The legislation I just introduced with my colleagues prevents family separation.

html: The Keep Families Together and Enforce the Law Act ensures children and parents receive fair and humane treatment and stay together during legal proceedings.

html: I believe we can strike the right balance between being compassionate—especially towards children who were brought here through no fault of their own—and also being smart by taking steps needed to prevent future illegal immigration. (3/3)
text: I believe we can strike the right balance between being compassionate—especially towards children who were brought here through no fault of their own—and also being smart by taking steps needed to prevent future illegal immigration. (3/3)

html: Our nation is long-overdue for commonsense immigration reform, particularly when it comes to providing a path to naturalization for DACA recipients and securing our borders. (2/3)
text: Our nation is long-overdue for commonsense immigration reform, particularly when it comes to providing a path to naturalization for DACA recipients and securing our borders. (2/3)

html: We should not be separating children migrants from their families. Congress can take action to provide better long-term certainty and consistency on this issue in a way that does not incentivize unauthorized border crossings. (1/3)
text: We should not be separating children migrants from their families. Congress can take action to provide better long-term certainty and consistency on this issue in a way that does not incentivize unauthorized border crossings. (1/3)

html: Last week, @POTUS signed the #VAMISSIONAct into law. This bill helps our nation’s #veterans by: Providing timely access to quality healthcare Consolidating VA community care programs Introducing modernized VA pilot programs Improving payment processing and care delivery
text:
Last week, @POTUS signed the #VAMISSIONAct into law.

This bill helps our nation’s #veterans by:
Providing timely access to quality healthcare
Consolidating VA community care programs
Introducing modernized VA pilot programs
Improving payment processing and care delivery

html: I support enacting additional sanctions on Russia. We must continue to hold Putin and his cronies accountable for their attacks on the United States and our allies.
text: I support enacting additional sanctions on Russia. We must continue to hold Putin and his cronies accountable for their attacks on the United States and our allies.

html: As Speaker of the House of NC, we crafted reforms to our criminal justice system that reduced recidivism, saved NC hundreds of millions of dollars, promoted public safety & allowed us to reinvest money to public safety. I want to replicate these results on the federal level.
text: As Speaker of the House of NC, we crafted reforms to our criminal justice system that reduced recidivism, saved NC hundreds of millions of dollars, promoted public safety & allowed us to reinvest money to public safety. I want to replicate these results on the federal level.

html: Although the bill is not perfect, I look forward to working with my colleagues to modernize our criminal justice system to reduce recidivism and promote public safety. #CJReform
text: Although the bill is not perfect, I look forward to working with my colleagues to modernize our criminal justice system to reduce recidivism and promote public safety. #CJReform

html: I voted for the Sentencing Reform and Corrections Act, bipartisan legislation that increases access to recidivism reduction programs & helps prisoners successfully re-enter society & narrows some mandatory minimum sentences to focus on violent offenders & serious drug offenders.
text: I voted for the Sentencing Reform and Corrections Act, bipartisan legislation that increases access to recidivism reduction programs & helps prisoners successfully re-enter society & narrows some mandatory minimum sentences to focus on violent offenders & serious drug offenders.

html: It’s clear the only path forward to providing a permanent solution for #DACA, securing our borders & modernizing our immigration system is building consensus on a plan @POTUS supports & can be signed into law. I’ll continue to work on both sides of the aisle to reach consensus.
text: It’s clear the only path forward to providing a permanent solution for #DACA, securing our borders & modernizing our immigration system is building consensus on a plan @POTUS supports & can be signed into law. I’ll continue to work on both sides of the aisle to reach consensus.

html: The Schumer-Rounds-Collins plan is well-meaning but has serious flaws. For example on pg 64, it says our immigration laws should not be enforced for any new illegal aliens who are here or who entered the U.S. in the next 4 months, until June 30, until they commit a serious crime.pic.twitter.com/BYLzwW7VEX

html: Schumer-Rounds-Collins is well-intentioned but falls drastically short of being a proposal that can get a vote in the House and be signed into law. The Senate needs to learn from the Gang of 8 failure, not repeat it.

html: After 3 days of the unnecessary #SchumerShutdown, I’m glad my Democratic colleagues voted to fund our government and support our servicemembers, veterans and millions of children relying on CHIP. It's time to move forward and continue discussions for DACA/Border Security.

html: We have been talking for months about ways to address Congress’ unfinished business — military spending, disaster relief, healthcare, immigration, and border security. Now those talks can get going again.
text:
We have been talking for months about ways to address Congress’ unfinished business — military spending, disaster relief, healthcare, immigration, and border security.

Now those talks can get going again.

html: Once the government reopens those conversations can and will speed up. But it is imperative that Congress comes together to find solutions in a way that doesn’t jeopardize military, children’s healthcare, and important gov’t functions.
text: Once the government reopens those conversations can and will speed up. But it is imperative that Congress comes together to find solutions in a way that doesn’t jeopardize military, children’s healthcare, and important gov’t functions.
